title: Calories in One Onion Ring
meta_description: Discover calories in a onion ring, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per ring with tweaks and FAQs for better choices.
assumptions: Standard fast-food style onion ring, battered, deep-fried in vegetable oil; medium size (~25 g), no added dips.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, frying method, oil type, and batter recipe. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard onion ring has about 75 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (air-fried or oven)

faqs.q: How many calories in a onion ring from fast food?
faqs.a: Typically 75 kcal for one medium fried onion ring.

faqs.q: Are onion rings high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 150 mg per ring due to batter and seasoning.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in one onion ring?
faqs.a: Around 4.3 g total fat, including 0.7 g saturated.
Baked versions reduce calories to ~45 kcal per ring by cutting oil.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a onion ring?
faqs.a: About 8.2 g carbs, with 0.5 g fiber and 1 g sugars.
